Welcome to ChiaraMail for Android setup. ChiaraMail for Android (or, simply, ChiaraMail) is a mail program based on K-9 Mail, an open source mail client for Android originally based on the standard Android Mail client. Use of ChiaraMail is easy and intuitive, especially if you\'re familiar with K-9 Mail.

ChiaraMail\'s features include:

* Easy securing of message content from viewing by third parties without the use of encryption
* Ephemeral messaging with prevention of screen capture
* 100% protection against mail address spoofing
* More efficient delivery of mail to large distribution lists
* Enabling you to change your e-mail, including attachments, after it had been sent
* Major reduction in mail storage space
* Send attachments of virtually unlimited size
* ... and more!

The ChiaraMail mail client is a functional superset of K-9 Mail. This means it does everything that K-9 Mail does, plus more. The primary difference is the use of Envelope-Content Splitting (ECS) technology (see above for a list of some of the benefits of ECS over traditional mail technology). ChiaraMail also offers ECS implementations that enable your favorite mail clients, including Mozilla Thunderbird and Microsoft Outlook**, to use the technology. For more information about ECS, how it works and more of its benefits, see http://www.chiaramailcorp.com/about/works/.

Please submit bug reports, suggestions for new features and questions to support@chiaramail.com.

Enhancements and bug fixes in Version 4.53:

1. Fixed bug: Removed package name from references to MessageCompose.class in source code, in an effort to fix ActivityNotFoundException bug. ** Assumes all mail recipients are ECS-enabled (download additional implementations from http://www.chiaramailcorp.com/downloads)
Google, The K-9 Dog Walkers and ChiaraMail Corp.

ECS messaging may be hosted by the public content server (managed by ChiaraMail and whose server name is www.chiaramail.com) or by a private server, e.g., by your bank. You may configure private servers here, by specifying the content server name, port, account password and other settings. The owner of the content server will provide those values when you register. 

When you receive an ECS message, the address of the content server (public or private) will be specified in the message header and the configuration you have created for that server will be used to retrieve the message content.

The configuration of the default content server is used when you send an ECS message or when you reply to or forward one whose content is hosted on a different server.

Would you like to invite some of your contacts to download ChiaraMail for Android or another of ChiaraMail\'s Envelope-Content Splitting (ECS)-enabling products? Remember, in order for your recipients to be able to read messages you send using ECS, their mail programs must be enabled for ECS.\n\nTo send your contacts an invitation, press the menu button, followed by \"Invite contacts\", to bring up your contacts list. Select the people on the list you wish to send an e-mail invitation to, then press the \"Preview Invite\" button to preview the message before sending it.

To read this secure message, please download the appropriate ECS extension for your mail client or one of our ECS-enabled mobile mail clients (http://www.chiaramailcorp.com/downloads/).

Hi,

I don't want my e-mail provider (Google, Microsoft, Yahoo,…) reading my e-mail anymore, so I installed ChiaraMail support into my mail programs and I invite you to do the same. 

Besides protecting our privacy, the ChiaraMail products from ChiaraMail Corp. help guard against email spoofing, in which others try to trick us into revealing our bank login credentials and such. ChiaraMail also enables us to keep control of any e-mail we send, including letting us change or delete an e-mail after we've sent it (Yes! Really!) and even make it disappear a few seconds after it's been read. 

As if that weren't enough, ChiaraMail allows us to send attachments of practically unlimited size (imagine sending a video to some friends that only takes 291 bytes of space in their inboxes) and also speeds up mail delivery.

I think this is a big deal and wanted to share the news about it with you. Get ChiaraMail today from http://www.chiaramailcorp.com/downloads and take control of your e-mail like I did!

Regards,
Write to me using ChiaraMail, the next-generation e-mail technology!

Del (or D) - Delete
 R - Reply
 A - Reply All
 C - Compose
 F - Forward
 M - Move
 V - Archive
 Y - Copy
 Z - Mark (Un)read
 G - Star
 O - Sort type
 I - Sort order
 Q - Return to Folders
 S - Select/deselect
 J or P - Previous Message
 K or N - Next Message
All headers have been downloaded, but there are no additional headers to show.
Error removing recipient from access list:
Custom settings. Choose this option to display the underlying checkboxes that control how your message will be sent.

ECS e-mail. Select this option of you wish to be able to change your message after sending it or enable any of the other features available to ECS, other than self-destruct mode. Messages sent as ECS are visible only to recipients whose mail clients are enabled for ECS, such as ChiaraMail for Android, ChiaraMail for Thunderbird or ChiaraMail for Outlook, these last two with their respective ECS extensions installed.

Self destruct e-mail. In self-destruct mode, messages will disappear after a fixed duration. If your recipient is viewing a self-destruct message on ChiaraMail for Android, screen capture will be automatically disabled; on other platforms, it will be enabled. As with the ECS e-mail option, your recipents must have an ECS-enabled mail client in order to view self-destruct messages.
How do you wish to send messages by default? You will be able to change the default settings when you send your message later, if you wish.
Standard e-mail. In this mode, your message would be readable by any mail client, but you won\'t be able to change it after sending it, nor will you be able to make it self-destruct.
